author: lgray
body:
This PR adds in a number of features for HGC and more importantly some non-invasive additions to the vertexing.

All features are related to fast timing:
- HGC ToT readout ( 60 fC threshold )
- Current work in progress in propagating 4D measurements through the vertexing
  - All the old 3x3 matrix and 3D point accessors are retained, no change expected, achieved by returning the submatrix or subvector of what's in the internal object.
  - 4x4 matrices and 4D points are added though same methods with "4D" at the end
  - Vertices know if they are 4D or not.
  - A new package is added "RecoFTL" (Reco for Fast-Timing-Layer) that right now defines a kludge to associate sim-track timing information to the reconstructed tracks.

It compiles (312 package checkout, as a warning).
It runs on a PU = 10 sample and gives the same results as before for the "3D" stuff (4D is work in progress).

Please double check there are no weird or unexpected regressions.
title: Baseline for Hermetic Timing Demo (SLHCDEV)
